hallucination.英释: something which you imagine you can see or hear, but which is not really there, or the experience of this

controversial.英释: causing a lot of disagreement, because many people have strong opinions about the subject being discussed

contradictory.英释: two statements, beliefs etc that are contradictory are different and therefore cannot both be true or correct

complementary.英释: complementary things go well together, although they are usually different

inadvertently.英释: without realizing what you are doing

interrogative.英释: an interrogative sentence, pronoun etc asks a question or has the form of a question. For example, ‘who’ and ‘what’ are interrogative pronouns.

compassionate.英释: feeling sympathy for people who are suffering

topographical.英释: A topographical survey or map relates to or shows the physical features of an area of land, for example, its hills, valleys, and rivers

temperamental.英释: likely to suddenly become upset, excited, or angry – used to show disapproval

unaccountable.中释: 无责任的；莫名其妙的；不可理解的
unaccountable.英释: very surprising and difficult to explain

rectification.中释: 改正，矫正；[化工] 精馏；[电] 整流；[数] 求长
rectification.英释: The rectification of something that is wrong is the act of changing it to make it correct or satisfactory

unconditional.中释: 无条件的；绝对的；无限制的
unconditional.英释: not limited by or depending on any conditions

unpretentious.中释: 谦逊的；含蓄的；不炫耀的；不铺张的
unpretentious.英释: not trying to seem better, more important etc than you really are – use this to show approval

preoccupation.中释: 全神贯注，入神；当务之急；关注的事物；抢先占据；成见
preoccupation.英释: when someone thinks or worries about something a lot, with the result that they do not pay attention to other things

comparatively.英释: as compared to something else or to a previous state

philanthropic.英释: a philanthropic person or institution gives money and help to people who are poor or in trouble

diametrically.中释: 完全地；作为直径地；直接地；正好相反地

entertainment.英释: things such as films, television, performances etc that are intended to amuse or interest people

hypercritical.英释: too eager to criticize other people and things, especially about small details

autobiography.英释: a book in which someone writes about their own life, or books of this type

accompaniment.英释: music that is played in the background at the same time as another instrument or singer that plays or sings the main tune

inexhaustible.英释: something that is inexhaustible exists in such large amounts that it can never be finished or used up

individualism.中释: 个人主义；利己主义；个人特征
individualism.英释: the belief that the rights and freedom of individual people are the most important rights in a society

heterogeneous.中释: [化学] 多相的；异种的；[化学] 不均匀的；由不同成分形成的
heterogeneous.英释: consisting of parts or members that are very different from each other

confrontation.英释: a situation in which there is a lot of angry disagreement between two people or groups

foreknowledge.英释: knowledge that something is going to happen before it actually does

counterattack.英释: an attack you make against someone who has attacked you, in a war, sport, or argument

brainstorming.中释: 集思广益以寻找；集体自由讨论（brainstorm的ing形式）

psychoanalyst.中释: 精神分析学家；心理分析学家
psychoanalyst.英释: someone who treats patients using psychoanalysis

contraception.英释: the practice of preventing a woman from becoming  pregnant  when she has sex, or the methods for doing this

typographical.英释: Typographical relates to the way in which printed material is presented

irrepressible.中释: 抑制不住的；压服不了的
irrepressible.英释: An irrepressible person is lively and energetic and never seems to be depressed

sophisticated.中释: 使变得世故；使迷惑；篡改（sophisticate的过去分词形式）

redevelopment.英释: the act of redeveloping an area, especially in a city

differentiate.英释: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

sportsmanship.英释: Sportsmanship is behaviour and attitudes that show respect for the rules of a game and for the other players

schizophrenia.英释: a serious mental illness in which someone’s thoughts and feelings are not based on what is really happening around them

environmental.中释: 环境的，周围的；有关环境的
environmental.英释: concerning or affecting the air, land, or water on Earth

microorganism.英释: a living thing that is so small that it cannot be seen without a  microscope

irretrievable.中释: 不能弥补的；不能复原的；无法挽救的
irretrievable.英释: an irretrievable situation cannot be made right again

contradiction.英释: a difference between two statements, beliefs, or ideas about something that means they cannot both be true

hundredweight.英释: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 112 pounds or 50.8 kilograms in Britain, and 100 pounds or 45.3 kilograms in the US

Mediterranean.英释: relating to the Mediterranean Sea, or typical of the area of southern Europe around it

psychological.中释: 心理的；心理学的；精神上的
psychological.英释: relating to the way that your mind works and the way that this affects your behaviour

retrospective.英释: a show of the work of an  artist  , actor,  film-maker  etc that includes examples of all the kinds of work they have done

proliferation.英释: a sudden increase in the amount or number of something

industrialist.中释: 实业家；工业家；产业工人
industrialist.英释: a person who owns or runs a factory or industrial company

microcomputer.中释: 微电脑；[计] 微型计算机

insignificant.英释: Something that is insignificant is unimportant, especially because it is very small

knowledgeable.中释: 知识渊博的，有知识的；有见识的；聪明的

chrysanthemum.英释: a garden plant with large brightly coloured flowers

concentration.中释: 浓度；集中；浓缩；专心；集合
concentration.英释: the ability to think about something carefully or for a long time

pronunciation.英释: the way in which a language or a particular word is pronounced

miscellaneous.中释: 混杂的，各种各样的；多方面的，多才多艺的
miscellaneous.英释: a miscellaneous set of things or people includes many different things or people that do not seem to be connected with each other

collaboration.英释: when you work together with another person or group to achieve something, especially in science or art

multinational.英释: a large company that has offices, factories etc in many different countries

radioactivity.中释: 放射性；[核] 放射能力；[核] 放射现象
radioactivity.英释: the sending out of  radiation (= a form of energy )  when the  nucleus (= central part )  of an atom has broken apart

disappointing.中释: 令人失望（disappoint的ing形式）；辜负…的期望

biotechnology.中释: [生物] 生物技术；[生物] 生物工艺学
biotechnology.英释: the use of living things such as cells,  bacteria  etc to make drugs, destroy waste matter etc

argumentative.英释: someone who is argumentative often argues or likes arguing

extraordinary.中释: 非凡的；特别的；离奇的；临时的；特派的
extraordinary.英释: very much greater or more impressive than usual

configuration.英释: the shape or arrangement of the parts of something

encouragement.英释: when you encourage someone or something, or the things that encourage them

conscientious.中释: 认真的；尽责的；本着良心的；小心谨慎的
conscientious.英释: careful to do everything that it is your job or duty to do

international.中释: 国际的；两国（或以上）国家的；超越国界的；国际关系的；世界的
international.英释: relating to or involving more than one nation

communicative.中释: 交际的；爱说话的，健谈的；无隐讳交谈的
communicative.英释: able to talk easily to other people

indeterminate.中释: 不确定的；模糊的；含混的
indeterminate.英释: If something is indeterminate, you cannot say exactly what it is

revolutionary.英释: someone who joins in or supports a political or social revolution

indispensable.中释: 不可缺少之物；必不可少的人

inconceivable.中释: 不可思议的；难以置信的；不能想象的；非凡的
inconceivable.英释: too strange or unusual to be thought real or possible

psychotherapy.英释: the treatment of mental illness, for example  depression  , by talking to someone and discussing their problems rather than giving them drugs

demonstration.英释: an event at which a large group of people meet to protest or to support something in public

disadvantaged.中释: 使处于不利地位（disadvantage的过去式和过去分词）

antilogarithm.中释: 逆对数；[数] 反对数；真数
antilogarithm.英释: a number whose logarithm to a given base is a given number

rapprochement.中释: 友好；恢复邦交；友善关系的建立
rapprochement.英释: the establishment of a good relationship between two countries or groups of people, after a period of unfriendly relations

embarrassment.中释: 窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据
embarrassment.英释: the feeling you have when you are embarrassed

parenthetical.中释: 插句的；附加说明的；放在括号里的
parenthetical.英释: said or written while you are talking or writing about something else in order to explain something or add information

chronological.中释: 按年代顺序排列的；依时间前后排列而记载的
chronological.英释: arranged according to when things happened or were made

consideration.英释: careful thought and attention, especially before making an official or important decision

correspondent.中释: 通讯记者；客户；通信者；代理商行
correspondent.英释: someone who is employed by a newspaper or a television station etc to report news from a particular area or on a particular subject

reinforcement.英释: more soldiers, police etc who are sent to a battle, fight etc to make their group stronger

introspection.英释: the process of thinking deeply about your own thoughts, feelings, or behaviour

irresponsible.英释: doing careless things without thinking or worrying about the possible bad results

individuality.中释: 个性；个人；个人特征；个人的嗜好（通常复数）
individuality.英释: the qualities that make someone or something different from other things or people

administrator.英释: someone whose job involves managing the work of a company or organization

uncooperative.英释: not willing to work with or help someone

neighbourhood.中释: 邻近；周围；邻居关系；附近一带
neighbourhood.英释: the area around you or around a particular place, or the people who live there

communication.中释: 通讯，[通信] 通信；交流；信函
communication.英释: the process by which people exchange information or express their thoughts and feelings

unforgettable.英释: an unforgettable experience, sight etc affects you so strongly that you will never forget it, especially because it is particularly good or beautiful

hydroelectric.中释: 水力发电的；水电治疗的
hydroelectric.英释: using water power to produce electricity

manifestation.英释: a very clear sign that a particular situation or feeling exists

misunderstand.英释: to fail to understand someone or something correctly

quadrilateral.英释: having or formed by four sides

disillusioned.中释: 使幻想破灭（disillusion的过去分词）；唤醒

dishonourable.中释: 不名誉的；无耻的；不受尊重的（等于dishonorable）

inappropriate.英释: not suitable or right for a particular purpose or in a particular situation

investigation.英释: an official attempt to find out the truth about or the cause of something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

thermonuclear.中释: [核] 热核的；高热原子核反应的
thermonuclear.英释: thermonuclear weapons use a  nuclear  reaction, involving the splitting of atoms, to produce very high temperatures and a very powerful explosion

unceremonious.中释: 随便的，不拘礼节的；无礼貌的
unceremonious.英释: without ceremony; informal, abrupt, rude, or undignified

advertisement.英释: a picture, set of words, or a short film, which is intended to persuade people to buy a product or use a service, or that gives information about a job that is available, an event that is going to happen etc

underestimate.英释: a guessed amount or number that is too low

determination.英释: the quality of trying to do something even when it is difficult

hieroglyphics.中释: [语] 象形文字；难以辨认或理解的文字（hieroglyphic的复数形式）
hieroglyphics.英释: pictures and symbols used to represent words or parts of words, especially in the ancient Egyptian writing system

perpendicular.英释: an exactly vertical position or line

uncomfortable.英释: not feeling physically comfortable, or not making you feel comfortable

parliamentary.中释: 议会的；国会的；议会制度的
parliamentary.英释: relating to or governed by a parliament

disinterested.中释: 使不再有利害关系；使无兴趣（disinterest的过去分词）

qualification.中释: 资格；条件；限制；赋予资格
qualification.英释: if you have a qualification, you have passed an examination or course to show you have a particular level of skill or knowledge in a subject

accommodation.中释: 住处，膳宿；调节；和解；预订铺位
accommodation.英释: a place for someone to stay, live, or work

circumference.英释: the distance or measurement around the outside of a circle or any round shape

surreptitious.中释: 秘密的；鬼鬼祟祟的；暗中的
surreptitious.英释: done secretly or quickly because you do not want other people to notice

comprehensive.中释: 综合学校；专业综合测验

granddaughter.英释: the daughter of your son or daughter

establishment.英释: the act of starting an organization, relationship, or system

authoritative.中释: 有权威的；命令式的；当局的
authoritative.英释: an authoritative book, account etc is respected because the person who wrote it knows a lot about the subject

institutional.英释: institutional attitudes and behaviour have existed for a long time in an organization and have become accepted as normal even though they are bad

constellation.中释: [天] 星座；星群；荟萃；兴奋丛
constellation.英释: a group of stars that forms a particular pattern and has a name

mathematician.英释: someone who studies or teaches mathematics, or is a specialist in mathematics

unprecedented.英释: never having happened before, or never having happened so much

contraceptive.英释: A contraceptive method or device is used to prevent pregnancy

physiotherapy.英释: a treatment that uses special exercises, rubbing, heat etc to treat medical conditions and problems with muscles

unquestioning.中释: 不提出疑问的；不犹豫的；盲目的；无异议的；无条件的
unquestioning.英释: an unquestioning faith, attitude etc is very certain and without doubts

demonstrative.英释: In grammar, the words "this," "that," "these," and "those" are sometimes called demonstratives

electrostatic.英释: of, concerned with, producing, or caused by static electricity

authoritarian.中释: 权力主义者；独裁主义者

companionship.英释: when you are with someone you enjoy being with, and are not alone

electromagnet.中释: 电磁体，[电] 电磁铁；电磁石
electromagnet.英释: a piece of metal that becomes magnetic(= able to attract metal objects ) when an electric current is turned on

scintillation.中释: 闪烁；发出火花；才华横溢
